Gregor Johann Mendelâ€™s contribution to science was his discovery of the principles of inheritance and variation. He laid the foundation for the science of genetics.

Based on his experiments, Mendel proposed two fundamental principles of inheritance: the law of segregation and the law of independent assortment. These principles had a profound impact on the scientific understanding of heredity and variation, and simultaneously paved the way for a new era of scientific inquiry into the nature of life itself.
